candidates.name: CSV Cleaner for Small Businesses
candidates.first10_steps:
1) Create SEO landing pages per destination
2) Run $10/day on intent keywords
3) Add freemium limit
4) Convert via $9 one-time or $5/mo

voc_quotes.quote: I keep getting import errors and I don’t know what’s wrong with my CSV.
I just want a tool that tells me what to fix and lets me download a clean file.
I only need this once in a while, not a monthly subscription.

candidates.assumptions: Occasional use fits one-time pricing; templates increase success rate.

candidates.name: Instant Quote Widget for Local Services
candidates.first10_steps:
1) Build 1-page demo
2) Offer 10 free installs
3) Convert to $49/mo after 14 days
4) Collect testimonials

competitors.name: Calconic
competitors.gap: Builder is powerful but setup friction

voc_quotes.quote: People ask for prices and never fill out my contact form.
If I could text them a quote instantly I’d book more jobs.
I don’t want a full CRM, just a simple estimator widget.

candidates.assumptions: SMBs pay if it clearly increases leads; SMS delivery is key differentiator.

candidates.name: Tab Sweeper for Work Sessions
candidates.first10_steps:
1) Ship free basic version
2) Post on r/chrome_extensions and productivity subs
3) Offer 50 beta codes for Pro
4) Ask for reviews

competitors.name: The Great Suspender
competitors.gap: No ‘session sweep’ + no savings feedback loop

competitors.name: OneTab
competitors.gap: Batch list only; no auto-group + no restore UX

competitors.name: Workona
competitors.gap: Too heavy; setup friction for casual users

voc_quotes.quote: My tabs get out of control and it kills my focus.
I want something simple that just closes or sleeps tabs automatically.
Most tab managers feel like a whole project to set up.

candidates.assumptions:
Users will pay small fee for ‘set and forget’ + visible time saved.
Chrome store discovery + Reddit can seed first users.
